Louvre for Families !!! My Best seller experience with more than 680 reviews 5‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú® on Airbnb .
After guiding the Louvre for 5 years almost every day I have became if not the Best  one of the best guides for families in Paris.  Learning from the amazing collections of the Louvre is the best way to get the best of your visit . My method relies on playful learning pedagogy- from the Harvard Docent School and my own experience in architecture , design and history of art .
My content is challenging and not easy as I believe kids are totally able to talk about art with a discerning eye and this is what we train while learning art history and French history at the Louvre .  #louvretours, #pariskids ,  #louvreatfirstsight , #pedagogyofplay

PERMANENT EXHIBIT at @museedartmodernedeparis (free entrance for all) gives the opportunity to playful learn about the Invention of Electricity .  Huge work of art made byRaoul@Dufy in 1937 for the Exposition Universelle .
This is one the largest paintings of the world with 600m2  surface and a beautiful interface where kids can play an image treasure hunt .
Following chronological the d‚ÄôOrsay Collection- Visit this museum !!!! and its restaurant @____f_o_r_e_s_t_____ by @juliensebbag üòã

Back from summer Vacations we visited this Fresh- Playful and beautiful exhibit by @Marcel Broodthaers presenting ‚Äúa second of eternity ‚Äú at @fondationpinault .
Finishing in Fall 2023

The ZOO of Paris located at Vincennes Park  keeps 3000 animals ü¶í ü¶çüêÖ14 hectares , 180 species mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish and invertebrates, the zoo takes you on a genuine world tour of animal biodiversity.

The key principles behind the zoo‚Äôs architectural and landscape design are showing the animals in surroundings which replicate their native ecosystems, respecting their biozones and immersing the visitor.
 Before going Consult the schedule of the daily activities the Zoo offers as you might have the chance to see animals even closer ! 
#pariskids ,#pariszoo

The 4 Legs (arbaletrieres)  of the Eiffel Tower are  the key of its construction and aerodynamic. Design .
Indeed each leg is aligned to the 4 cardinal points with f sharp angles that will neutralise the wind‚Äôs force . In fact the whole structure works in minimising the force of the wind rendering it light and aerodynamic!!! .
This is just the tip of the iceberg of what you can Learn from my Eiffel Tower visit !!! It‚Äôs fame goes beyond the iconic üò≤‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®#eiffeltower #eiffeltowerparis

Champs √âlys√©es is more than a glamorous avenue, it is a place to discover and enjoy in all its beautiful little gardens and fountains. caption:
Puces de St Ouen ‚ÄúThe true treasure hunt‚Äù . It all started in 1870 when the comerciantes of second hand objects where set out of the city to do their activity. With the time it evolved into a very selected group of collectionists that offer their findings to people looking for something really really unique and special.
This is paradise for all collectors, designers and artists , as you don‚Äôt know what you could find as is a labyrinth and a true Ali Baba tavern.
Don‚Äôt hesitate coming in family and asking me for advice in case you go ‚ò∫Ô∏èhighly recommended.
#fleemarketparis #march√©stouen #true treasures, #parisianstyle #parisfamiles

The colors of Paris / Rooftop Views
These roofs are made out of Zinc and are a natural evoluci√≥n of slate roofs. However is in 1860 when Paris biggest urban transformations took place and the City's prefect :Baron Haussman, stablished Zinc material to be use in all buildings. Light, easy to fix and modern Zin is one of the akins of Paris üòò
This is also smarth landmark solution, as it will highlight Cooper only for exceptional buildings and Monuments.
